Today, together with COCAHICH, a historic individual and collective reparation agreement was agreed upon.
The points of the agreement were discussed and agreed during a meeting between those affected and representatives of the PDH.
The document includes 33 communities in the departments of Quiché, Alta and Baja Verapaz.
It also contains measures to repair housing, land, sanitation and health of the inhabitants.

After a meeting with @RadhaStoves executive director of the Global Alliance for Clean Stoves, Guatemala joins the initiative.
Guatemala joins the group of 8 countries with the Global Alliance for Clean Stoves to reduce the use of firewood in rural households.
It seeks to install 650 thousand stoves in the same number of homes over a period of 15 years, with the aim of preserving our environment
